intro: Urophyllum micranthum, commonly known as the small-flowered urophyllum, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers are arranged in clusters, and it produces achenes as its seeds. Urophyllum micranthum is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
